title: Meme Social Media App
description: This was a really fun group project! We worked as a team to come up with this meme generator using React and Django. On the surface, this app looks simple, but there were a lot of complexities that went into it, such as user authentication, the ability to post comments, and prevent users from liking a post more than once.  The challenges were exciting to overcome, and I'm proud of the outcome.

title: E-Commerce Marketplace
description: I really enjoyed working with a team on this project. I started off working on the backend, which I really enjoy, then hopped on to frontend functionality with the rest of the team. Please check out the GitHub for information on the collaborators.

title: Interactive Matching Game
description: I had a lot of fun creating this nostalgic game. Matching was my favorite game as a kid; I loved playing with my mom. This project came with a lot of fun challenges. But now that the bugs are worked out, I'm excited to scale this project in the future to add levels, more cards, and more fun!

title: Art Gallery Database
description: I found this backend API project to be intensely satisfying. I really enjoy working with databases and creating the backend functionality. Honestly, I enjoyed that there was no styling with this project - it was just code, and it was beautiful. *Note to non-developers: make sure your browser has a 'json prettier' extension, or this will all look like nonsense.

title: What's Going On In Wakefield
description: My first foray into Tableau, and I love it so much. I loved finding this outlier in the dataset and investigating further. This was the perfect blend of data representation & investigative journalism.

title: What We Do In The Shadows
description: Happy Halloween! From a very large dataset of all the horror movies listed on IMDb 2012-2017, I narrowed in on this outlier. A success across all metrics!

title: New York Dogs
description: My passion project! I moved to NY in June '23, and I've been taking photos of all the dogs I see around town.  This React site is a work in progress; I plan to build out lots of functionality over the coming months, but I'm very pleased with how it looks so far.
